message.content: This question requires an understanding of how soil composition impacts the availability of oxygen. When soil is loose, meaning the particles are not tightly packed together, it creates spaces and air pockets within the soil. This makes it easier for oxygen to enter the soil and reach the roots of plants. Therefore, option (D) - simpler - is the correct answer. Option (A) is unrelated to soil composition. Option (B) is subjective and does not provide any information about the oxygen availability in loose soil. Option (C) is incorrect because loose soil actually makes it easier, not harder, for oxygen to penetrate.

This question requires understanding of the relationship between soil structure and oxygen availability. When the soil is loose, it creates larger spaces or pores between soil particles. These spaces allow for easier movement of gases, including oxygen, into the soil. So, if the soil is loose, it makes it simpler for oxygen to get in. Option (A) is unrelated to the question. Option (B) is subjective and not related to soil properties. Option (C) is incorrect because when the soil is loose, it actually makes it easier, not harder, for oxygen to get in.
